title: How to Play Music on your Amazon Alexa

steps.title: Open the Alexa app.
steps.content: Open the Alexa app. On your Android or iOS phone, open the mobile Alexa app and sign in to your Amazon account. It's the light-blue app with a white outline of a speech bubble. Make sure you are signed in to the same Amazon account that you registered your Alexa device with.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's the three-lined icon in the top-left corner of the screen. This opens a pop-out menu on the left side of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Music, Video, & Books.
steps.content: Tap Music, Video, & Books . It's the first option in the menu under your account name at the top.

steps.title: Select the music service you want to link.
steps.content: Select the music service you want to link. It's in the "Music" section of the page. Tap any of the following music services you want to link to your Alexa device: Amazon Music Spotify Pandora iHeartRADIO tunein SiriusXM

steps.title: Tap link your account now.
steps.content: Tap link your account now . Follow the steps to link your account, this usually just involves signing into your account for the music service you subscribe to.

steps.title: In the Alexa App, tap ☰.
steps.content: In the Alexa App, tap ☰ . it's in the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's the second from last option at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Music & Media.
steps.content: Tap Music & Media . It's the first option in the "Alexa Preferences" section.

steps.title: Tap Choose Default Music Services.
steps.content: Tap Choose Default Music Services . It's the blue button at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Choose a default music library.
steps.content: Choose a default music library. Choose the streaming service you want to be the default if so you can use voice commands without having to specify which service to use. The only options available are the services that are already installed.

steps.title: Choose a default station service.
steps.content: Choose a default station service. Choose the station (radio) service (like Pandora or iHeartRADIO) that you want to be default so you can use voice commands without having to specify which service to use. The only options available are the services that are already installed.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It's the blue button at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Say "Alexa".
steps.content: Say "Alexa" . Say the wake command to wake Alexa and she will begin listening for your next command. The default wake command is "Alexa," but if you've changed it to "Echo," "Amazon," or some other command, then use the wake command you previously set.

steps.title: Ask Alexa to play any artist, song, album or genre.
steps.content: Ask Alexa to play any artist, song, album or genre. If you don't specify what music service to play the music with, Alexa will use whatever service is set at the default. For example, you could say, "Alexa, play Incense and Peppermints by the Strawberry Alarm Clock on Spotify," or "Alexa, play 60s music on Amazon." Saying just an artist's name will shuffle songs by that artist for you to listen to.

steps.title: Use playback controls with Alexa.
steps.content: Use playback controls with Alexa. Much like you would control your stereo or a music app on your phone, you can also use voice commands as playback controls. Pause, resume, and stop : You can say, "Alexa, pause," "Alexa, resume," and "Alexa, stop." Skip a song or go back to the previous song : You can say "Alexa, skip," "Alexa, next song/track." or "Alexa, previous song/track." Adjust the volume : You can say, "Alexa, volume up/down," or "Alexa, volume [1 - 10]" .

steps.title: Ask about the song currently being played.
steps.content: Ask about the song currently being played. [1] X Research source "Alexa, what is this song?" "Alexa, what album is this?" "Alexa, who plays this song?" "Alexa, what year did this song come out?"

steps.title: Use commands to help you find new music or music you've listened to before.
steps.content: Use commands to help you find new music or music you've listened to before. [2] X Research source "Alexa, play the top songs in Chicago." "Alexa, play the top songs in France." "Alexa, play more like this." "Alexa, play songs similar to Portugal the Man." "Alexa, play some Beatles songs I haven't heard in a while." "Alexa, play the music I was listening to on Wednesday." "Alexa, play what I was listening to yesterday morning."
